alert.note: Alert for Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Southern Hudspeth Highlands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 5:42PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hudspeth County through 515 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sierra Blanca, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sierra Blanca and Quitman Canyon. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 93 and 110. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso, Western Hudspeth Counties; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern Hudspeth County; Southern Hudspeth Highlands
